data.scheme_name: Dr. Babasaheb Ambedkar Udhyog Uday Yojana for SC/ST Entrepreneurs for MSME - Assistance of Capital Investment Subsidy - SC/ST - Existing
data.benefits: Scheme provides capital investment subsidies upto maximum 30% of the term loan amount (up to Rs. 40 lakhs) with additional amounts for eligible fixed capital investments above Rs. 1000 lakhs.
data.eligibility: SC/ST MSMEs in Manufacturing as per eligible category of taluka mentioned in Additional Information.
data.conditions:
1. Enterprise shall have to apply at online portal within one year from the date of disbursement of loan, or on or before the date of commencement of commercial production whichever is later. Applications submitted after one year will not be entitled for capital investment subsidy. 
2. Capital Investment subsidy will be paid only after the commencement of commercial production of the enterprise. 
3. Enterprises that receive term loans one year after commencing commercial production are ineligible for capital investment subsidy. 
4. If an enterprise is already availing capital subsidy from the Central Government, the combined subsidy from state and central sources cannot exceed the disbursed loan amount. 
5. Incentives are applicable only to new buildings, new plant and machinery/equipment, and second-hand imported machinery.
data.beneficiaries: SC/ST MSMEs in Manufacturing as per eligible category of taluka mentioned in Additional Information.
data.prerequisites:
1. Capital Subsidy will be eligible on Term Loan sanctioned and disbursed by Bank/FI (not eligible on loans by NBFC) 
2. The enterprise shall have to file information about annual production, sales, turnover, power consumptions, employment and such other details to concern DIC before end of September each year. 
3. Enterprise will have to observe pollution Control measures as prescribed by GPCB or other approval from other competent authority wherever applicable 
4. The enterprise will have to employ At least 85% of the workers, 60% of supervisory and managerial employment and overall 85% of the total employment must be from local persons. 
5. Enterprise have to remain in production for 7 years, else amount of capital investment subsidy disbursed will be recovered as arrears of land revenue. 
6. Only one activity out of Expansion, Forward Integration, Backward Integration and Diversification will be eligible for assistance during the operative period of the scheme.
data.context:
The Industrial Policy 2020 envisions Gujarat as a global business destination for next-generation sustainable manufacturing and service industry that stimulates sustainable development, inclusive and a balanced regional growth. 

The primary mission of the Industrial Policy includes support for development of MSMEs, focus on Export Competitiveness : Vocal for Local to become Global and thus strengthen integrated value chains across product segments.
data.objective: To provide Capital Investment to MSMEs to enhance their business with upgraded plant and machineries.
data.description:
1.  Category I Taluka - 30% of term loan amount, subject to maximum of Rs. 40 lakhs and if the eligible Fixed Capital Investment is above Rs. 10 crores, additional Rs. 10 lakhs will be given.
  2. Category II Taluka - 25% of term loan amount, subject to maximum of Rs. 35 lakhs and if the eligible Fixed Capital Investment is above Rs. 10 crores, additional Rs. 7.5 lakhs will be given.
  3. Category III Taluka and Municipal Corporation Areas - 15% of term loan amount, subject to maximum of Rs. 15 lakhs and if the eligible Fixed Capital Investment is above Rs. 10 crores, additional Rs. 5 lakhs will be given.
data.how_to_apply: Applicants can apply online within one year from the date of first disbursement of loan, or on or before the date of commencement of commercial production, whichever is later. - https://ifp.gujarat.gov.in/DIGIGOV/login.jsp
data.funding_facilitator: Industries and Mines Department, Government of Gujarat
data.funding_mechanism: The assistance will be released after the approval by Industries Commissioner.
data.additional_info:
The enterprise that has availed assistance under this component cannot avail assistance under any other scheme of other department of state government for the same component providing similar benefit. However, Enterprise can avail under such schemes of Government of India, if any.

  1. Category I - Dholera, Detroj - Rampura, Dhanduka, Khamba, Dhari, Lilia, Savar Kundla, Babra, Kunkavav Vadia, Lathi, Tarapur, Anklav, Sojitra, Dhansura, Malpur, Lakhani, Amirgadh, Suigam, Danta, Dhanera, Vav, Kankrej, Vadgam, Tharad, Deodar, Dantiwada, Netrang, Jesar, Umrala, Vallabhipur, Gariadhar, Palitana, Talaja, Ghogha, Ranpur, Gadhada, Barwala, Botad, Chhota Udepur, Kavant, Nasvadi, Sankheda, Bodeli, Jetpur Pavi, Kalyanpur, Bhanvad, Dhanpur, Sanjeli, Limkheda, Dahod, Fatepura, Jhalod, Singvad, Garbada, Devgadbaria, Gir Gadhada, Talala, Jodiya, Bhesan, Mendarda, Rapar, Nakhatrana, Lakhpat, Mandvi, Galteshwar, Matar, Vaso, Mahudha, Satlasana, Jotana, Kheralu, Becharaji, Vadnagar, Khanpur, Kadana, Virpur, Maliya, Garudeshwar, Dediapada, Tilakwada, Sagbara, Khergam, Ghoghamba, Morwa (Hadaf), Jambughoda, Shehera, Sarasvati, Santalpur, Shankheshwar, Sami, Radhanpur, Harij.
  2. Category II-  Viramgam, Rajula, Bagasara, Amreli, Umreth, Kambhat, Borsad, Petlad, Meghraj, Bayad, Bhiloda, Modasa, Deesa, Bhabhar, Palanpur, Amod, Jambusar, Valia, Mahuva, Sihor Category III Daskroi, Bavla, Dholka, Sanand, Mandal, Ahmedabad City, Anand, Jhagadia, Bharuch, Vagra, Anklesvar, Hansot, Bhavnagar, Khambalia, Kalol, Dehgam, Ghandinagar, Lalpur, Jamnagar, Junagadh, Junagadh City, Mundra, Anjar, Gandhidham, Kheda, Nadiad, Kadi, Mehsana, Wankaner, Morbi, Tankara, Navsari, Halol
data.checklist_info_a:
1. Signed copy of Application form* 
2. Signed copy of Undertaking* 
3. Copy of Udyam Registration (if applicable) 
4. Copy of the Constitution of the enterprise 
5. Copy of PAN Card of Enterprise 
6. Copy of Term Loan sanction letter 
7. Copy of Term Loan Account statement / Bank Certification of 1st disbursement certificate 
8. Copy of Detailed Project Report of the enterprise (if the project cost is up to Rs. 5 crores)  
9. Bank appraisal report (if the project cost is more than Rs. 5 crores)  
10. Shop & Establishment Certificate (if enterprise is engaged with Service sector in Municipal Corporation) 
11. Copy of GST registration (if applicable) 
12. Copy of ITR of the last financial year 
13. Self-declaration (for new enterprise) 
14. Copy of Birth Certificate/School Leaving Certificate (for entrepreneurs below the age of 35) 
15. Copy of Caste Certificate (if applicable) 
16. Copy of Certificate for differently abled (if applicable) 
17. Copy of Consent to Establish issued by the Gujarat Pollution Control Board (if applicable) 
18. Self-certified / Certified copy of anyone of the documents such as 7/12 Utara, Namuna 6, Copy of Index etc. 
19. Non-Agricultural Permission (if applicable) 
20. Copy of Notarized rent deed (Agreement 
21. Copy of lease deed (Agreement) 
22. Copy of the property Tax (for service activity) 
23. Board resolution for signing authority in case of partnership, LLP, Pvt. Ltd., Limited Company 
24. Undertaking (If the enterprise has another investment in the state of Gujarat) 
25. Annexure of Balance sheet showing the gross fix capital investment of previous financial year 
26. CA Certificate showing the gross fix capital investment before initiating any expansion activity
